Posts.Content: I have never heard of hair loss happening from hormonal therapy.
Posts.Title: Hair Loss From Femera

Posts.Content: That would be a wonderful endeavor. All the best to you Stacy
Posts.Title: Help! my Mom Was Diagnosed With Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Not many women are happy with the outcome of lumpectomy. About one-third of all patients are unhappy with how their breasts look after undergoing breast conservation treatment and a number of would consider reconstruction, See the article: http://medicineworld.org/cancer/lead/10-2006/some-breast-cancer-patients-unhappy-with-lumpectomy.html#main-content
Posts.Title: Unhappy With Lumpectomy Results?

Posts.Content: Now since all the lymph nodes are removed, I think you have a better chance.
Posts.Title: Lymph Node Question Please!

Posts.Content: See this article which speaks about this topic http://medicineworld.org/cancer/lead/6-2005/silencing-of-gene-helps-to-fight-breast-cancer.html
Posts.Title: Genetic Silencing

Posts.Content: Did they find any abnormality in any of these MRI? If there is an abnormality a biopsy is the best way to go. You may find this article useful http://www.breast-cancer-blog.com/blogs/permalinks/9-2006/when-you-find-a-mammogram-abnormality.html It talks about this issue.
Posts.Title: Mri Every 6 Months

Posts.Content: PET scan and MRI are not painful at all. Invasive ductal carcinoma is the scientific term for our commonly used term of breast cancer, hence this doesn’t mean anything new. Good luck to you
Posts.Title: Pet Scan and Mri, Any Precautions For Pain???

Posts.Content: I think, if the tumor is in the early stages, it might be best to remove it. Then again it depends on your mom’s general health.

Posts.Content: It was good to know that there was no cancer there

Posts.Content: You know most of the numbness and joint pain would go away once you stop the treatment. I am sure you would be a totally different person after one two months from now. Good luck.

Posts.Content: You should take chemotherapy. If the tumor is hormone receptor positive hormone therapy might be needed as well.

Posts.Content: The side effects of tamoxifen are not as bad as you think. These side effects are possible but rare to occur. Go with tamoxifen.

Posts.Title: Arimidex Verses Aromasin? Help me Rhonda!

Posts.Content: It is amazing how different social interactions comes into play when you are actually trying to take care of some health problems. Your best bet would be to call a family physician’s office and explain your situation
Posts.Title: Can't Seem to Get Help Getting a Mammogram

Posts.Content: Why should you switch from Arimidex to Aromasin? They both belong to aromatase inhibitors and what’s the point in switching?
Posts.Title: What Would Happen If...

Posts.Content: It makes no sense switching from arimidex to aromasin
